longDef.en: a group of students who are taught together at school, college, or university

examples.en: Which class are you in this year?
examples.cn: 今年你在哪个班？

examples.en: She gave the whole class extra homework for a week.
examples.cn: 她给全班额外布置了一星期的家庭作业。

examples.en: My class (= the people in my class) was/were rather noisy this morning.
examples.cn: 我的班里今天早上很吵。

examples.en: Okay, class, settle down and open your books.
examples.cn: 好了，同学们，安静下来，打开书本。

longDef.en: a period of time in which students are taught something

examples.en: My last class ends at four o'clock.
examples.cn: 我最后一堂课4点结束。

examples.en: I was told off for talking in class.
examples.cn: 我因为在课堂上讲话而受到了严厉批评。

examples.en: Who takes/teaches your environmental studies class?
examples.cn: 谁教你们环境学？

examples.en: I missed my aerobics class yesterday.
examples.cn: 我昨天没去上有氧健身操课。

examples.en: Classes have been cancelled today because of a staff meeting.
examples.cn: 因为有全体教工会议，今天的课取消了。

longDef.en: a group of students who successfully finished their studies in a particular year:

examples.en: The class of 2004 achieved the highest ever SAT scores in this district.

longDef.en: a group of people within society who have the same economic and social position

examples.en: The Labour Party has lost a lot of support among the working class.
examples.cn: 工党失去了工人阶级中许多人的支持。

examples.en: She belongs to the rich American upper class.
examples.cn: 她属于富裕的美国上层阶级。

examples.en: We live in a middle class neighbourhood.
examples.cn: 我们住在一个中产阶级居住区。

examples.en: She comes from an upper middle class background.
examples.cn: 她出身于中上层阶级家庭。

examples.en: He was a member of the ruling classes.
examples.cn: 他是统治阶级中的一员。

examples.en: She's studying the class structure of Japan.
examples.cn: 她在研究日本的阶级结构。

longDef.en: a group into which goods, services, or people are put according to their standard
longDef.cn: （货物、服务或人的）等级，类别，级别

examples.en: Whenever I travel by train, I always travel first class.
examples.cn: 我每次乘火车旅行都坐头等车厢。

examples.en: first/second class mail
examples.cn: 一类／二类邮件

examples.en: a business/economy class ticket
examples.cn: 商务舱／经济舱的机票

examples.en: When it comes to mathematics, he's in a different class to his peers.
examples.cn: 说到数学，他和他的同龄人不在一个级别上。

longDef.en: in the UK, the standard that someone has reached in their university degree

examples.en: What class of degree did you get?
examples.cn: 你得的是几等学位？

examples.en: He graduated with a second-class honours degree in physics.
examples.cn: 他以物理学二等优秀学位毕业。

longDef.en: in UK law, a group of illegal drugs classified according to how dangerous they are thought to be and how severe the punishment is for using or selling them, with class A the most dangerous :
longDef.cn: 他被控持有一种A类毒品，即海洛因。

examples.en: He was charged with possession of a class A drug, namely heroin.
examples.cn: 他被控持有一种A类毒品，即海洛因。

longDef.en: to be the best at a particular activity:
longDef.cn: 作为一名长跑选手，她是一流的。

examples.en: As a long-distance runner, she's in a class of her own.
examples.cn: 作为一名长跑选手，她是一流的。

longDef.en: to be something of such a high quality that nothing can be compared to it:

examples.en: In New York, it is clear that Dominican hair salons are in a class of their own.

longDef.en: to be much better at doing something than you:
longDef.cn: 我没法跟他对弈。他水平比我高多了！

examples.en: I can't play chess with him. He's completely out of my class!
examples.cn: 我没法跟他对弈。他水平比我高多了！

longDef.en: the quality of being stylish or fashionable

examples.en: She's got real class.
examples.cn: 她的确风姿优雅。

longDef.en: a group of related plants or animals, in the general classification of plants and animals
to consider someone or something to belong to a particular group because of their qualities

examples.en: I'm 17, but I'm still classed as a child when I travel by bus.
examples.cn: 我17岁了，可是乘公共汽车时仍然被视为儿童。

examples.en: I would class her among/with the top ten American novelists.
examples.cn: 我会将她列为美国最好的10位小说家之一。

examples.en: a class act
examples.cn: 出色的行为

examples.en: He's a class golfer.
examples.cn: 他是位一流的高尔夫球手。
